item.title: Report E-2025040116
item.description:
Report E-2025040116

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-07T21:14:44+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-10
  • City: EAST DEERFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Berkshire and Eastern Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: MULX 701436 arrived on MOED-10 on R2, loaded car of propane was found to be leaking B end liquid line. At approximately 2300 hrs, 3/10/2025, Hepaco received a call from Rita Mager, Berkshire & Eastern RR, requesting a response to leaking tank car at the Deerfield Yard. Hepaco arrived on site at 0100 hrs, 3/11/2025, and held safety briefing. At 0115 hrs, track protection was received and Hepaco mounted car. It was found that the B end liquid valve was not secured and the liquid valve secondary closure plug was less than tool tight. Hepaco made corrections in form of securing both the liquid valve and secondary closure. 0230 hrs, Hepaco offsite. There was no waste generated from this incident.

item.title: Report X-2025040722
item.description:
Report X-2025040722

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: LYNNFIELD
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS UNLOADED PALED AND SENT TO THE SOUTH SORT ISLE. THERE THE PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED TO BE LEAKING. THE SORTER LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED THE SUPERVISOR.THE SUPERVISOR THEN CALLED FOR A DESIGNATOR RESPONDER.THE RESPONDER, FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND APPROPRIATE RESPONCE SHEET PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE INTO A LINED SPILLED TUB. THE EQUIPMENT WAS DECONTAMINATED FOLLOWING THE DECONTAMINATION CHECK LIST, THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSPORTED TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING IT WAS THERE IT WAS DISCOVERED TO BE AN UNDECLEARED HAZMAT.

item.title: Report E-2025040035
item.description:
Report E-2025040035

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-25
  • City: NORTHBOROUGH
  • State: MA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When loading freight into trailer forklift operator went to pick up a pallet of drums and didn't realize the forkblades where too high and consequently struck two drums slightly puncturing them contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as were the two punctured drums.
